question: What is the definition of small for gestational age fetuses?

answers.option: Abdominal circumference less than the 10th centile
Weight more than 90th centile for the appropriate gestational age
Weight less than 10th centile for the appropriate gestational age

question: A baby delivered at 38 weeks of gestation by an emergency cesarean section did not establish respiration after birth. After stimulation and drying, the baby was given positive pressure ventilation. The most appropriate indicator for effective ventilation is:

A 28-year-old nulliparous woman comes to the outpatient department with inability to conceive for three years. She has a history of pelvic inflammatory disease treated two years ago. Which of the following is the gold standard test for tubal pregnancy?

A 55-year-old female presents with a 3-month history of postmenopausal bleeding. When she was 48 years old, she was diagnosed with endometrial hyperplasia on biopsy. However, she never returned for follow-up and never received treatment. Which of the following conditions is the most likely cause of her abnormal bleeding?

A 40-year-old female presents with a palpable breast mass of 2 cm. Mammography shows calcifications and a radiopaque mass. On biopsy, there is an increased number of acini that are compressed and distorted in the central portion of the lesion, in a fibrous stroma. Preserved double layer of the epithelium is present in immunohistochemistry. No nuclear atypia is identified. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-day-old female child, delivered by a lower segment cesarean section at 38 weeks of gestation is brought to the emergency room with a complaint of brownish discoloration of urine. On examination, she has a palpable mass in the right flank. Her mother has a history of pre-gestational diabetes. Birth weight is 4.0 kg, length 55 cm. CBC: Hb 22 gm/dl TLC: 15,000 platelets 75000/microliter. Urine detailed report shows numerous red blood cells. What is the most likely cause of this problem?
Which of the following is the mechanism of action of finasteride?

answers.option: Increase the serum levels of androstendione
Increase the serum levels of testosterone

question: A 27-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of bloody discharge from her right nipple. On examination, she is afebrile, and a mass is palpable on her right breast. The doctor orders a mammogram which shows a solitary subareolar nodule with dilation of the ducts. A biopsy of the lesion shows a central fibrovascular core, extending from the walls of the duct, occupying the lumen and lined by myoepithelial cells. Which of the following conditions is the likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of bloody discharge from the nipples and swelling in her right breast. On examination of the breast, a lump can be felt in the subareolar region and there is ulceration over the nipple. The physician orders a biopsy, which shows that the tumor is HER2 positive. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 25 year-old-woman, P2+0, presents to the gynecology outpatient department with the complaint of lower abdominal pain and foul-smelling vaginal discharge for the last 1 week. She had a copper intra-uterine device inserted 6 months ago. On abdominal examination, there is tenderness, and on pelvic examination, purulent discharge is noticed coming out from the cervix. What will be the best management option for this patient?

answers.option: Admit the patient and give IV antibiotics
Offer oral antibiotics for 14 days and then reassess
Send the culture and offer oral antibiotics for 14 days then reassess
Send the culture and reassure the patient

question: A 30-year-old married woman presents to the gynecology out-patient department with a complaint of foul-smelling vaginal discharge and itching for the last 2 weeks. She is a non-diabetic. On speculum examination, there is a homogenous white vaginal discharge. A probable diagnosis of bacterial vaginosis is made. Which of the following is not an Amsel's criteria to diagnose bacterial vaginosis?

A 30-year-old woman, P2+0, presents to the gynecology outpatient department with a complaint of a finger-like growth around her introitus since the last 6 months which has gradually increased in size. It is also associated with watery foul smelling vaginal discharge on and off. On examination, a diagnosis of genital warts is made. Which of the following is not a probable management option?

answers.option: Screening for other STIs, cervical cancer, partner screening followed by treatment
Ablative therapies, i.e. liquid nitrogen or surgical techniques

question: A 30-year-old woman, P2+0, presents to the gynecology outpatient department with a complaint of a finger-like growth around her introitus since the last 6 months which has gradually increased in size. It is also associated with watery foul smelling vaginal discharge on and off. On examination, a diagnosis of genital warts is made. Which of the following is the most probable management option?

answers.option: Screening for other STIs, cervical cancer, partner screening followed by treatment.
Ablative therapies, i.e. liquid nitrogen or surgical techniques

question: A 47-year-old multiparous woman presented to the gynecology outpatient department for increasing secondary dysmenorrhea and heavy menstrual bleeding. On per vaginal examination, the uterus is tender and enlarged. Ultrasound shows a large uterus of 11 cm without any mass. Which of the following can be used to make a definitive diagnosis of her problem?

A 34-year-old woman, para 2+0, visits the gynecology department with an ultrasound report showing an intramural fibroid 7x7 cm. She is not willing to undergo surgery and wishes to retain her fertility. After discussion, she opts for uterine artery embolization. Which of the following specialists performs uterine artery embolization?

A 34-year-old woman Mrs. ABC, gravida 2, para 1+0 presents to the antenatal clinic at 12 weeks of pregnancy. She gives a history of 1 Down syndrome baby and now she has come to discuss prenatal testing in the current pregnancy. Which of the following tests has the highest detection rate for screening for Down syndrome?

A 36-year-old unbooked female comes to the emergency department at 2 am with a history of spontaneous twin vaginal delivery 3 hours back at home followed by heavy vaginal bleeding. This is her fourth pregnancy with all previous normal vaginal deliveries. On arrival, she is semi-conscious with cold clammy skin and extremely pale in look. Her BP is 80/40 mmHg and her pulse is 132 beats/min. On abdominal examination, a boggy, relaxed uterus of 26 weeks size is palpable, and on vaginal examination, heavy vaginal bleeding is noticed. What should be the most immediate next step in her management?

A 26-year-old female, gravida 2, para 0+1 presents to the emergency department with the complaint of right iliac fossa pain. The patient has a history of appendectomy 2 years back and left-sided salpingectomy due to ectopic pregnancy 3 years back. On examination, she is hemodynamically unstable. On ultrasound, her uterine cavity is empty, and a right adnexal mass of 4 x 3 cm is noted. Her beta-HCG is 2800 mIU/mL. Which of the following is the most appropriate management in this case?

A 62-year-old female has been in menopause for 2 years. She is a known diabetic on insulin. On examination, her body mass index is 31 kg/m2. She presents to the gynecology clinic with complaints of two episodes of post-menopausal bleeding. Which of the following should be included in her initial investigations?

A 38-year-old patient presented in a gynecology clinic with complaints of frequent urination and nocturia. She was diagnosed with an overactive bladder. Her body mass index was 26 kg/m2 and the patient does not want to take any medicines. Which of the following is the most important lifestyle change that should be recommended to her?

A 35-year-old woman, para 2, presents to the gynecology clinic with complaints of dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, and dysuria. Her abdominal examination is unremarkable. The transvaginal scan is normal. On per vaginal examination, there is tenderness in the pouch of Douglas with retroverted fixed uterus and thickening of the uterosacral ligament. What should be the most appropriate treatment for this patient?

A mother has brought her 19-year-old daughter into the outpatient department with a history of inability to menstruate. The patient has two siblings with normal menstrual cycles. There is a history of coarctation of the aorta, other history is not significant. On examination, she has a short stature and, a wide carrying angle, and her ultrasound pelvis shows streak ovaries. Her Hb is 8 g/dl and FSH is 60 mIU/mL. The given explanation best corresponds to which of the following?

A 31-year-old female, P3+1, presents to the outpatient department with a history of cessation of menstruation for the last 3 years. All of her deliveries are normal vaginal deliveries and her last birth was 3 years ago with a history of cervical tears for which she had received multiple transfusions. Her last miscarriage was 4 years ago with a history of dilatation and evacuation. On examination, she is an obese female with a body mass index of 26 Kg/m2, enlarged thyroid, and pallor positive. Her ultrasound pelvis shows a normal uterus and ovaries. The given explanation best corresponds to which of the following?

A couple is attending a follow-up in a gynecology clinic with a complaint of inability to conceive since 5 years of their marriage. The female has a body mass index of 23 Kg/m2 and regular menstrual cycles. Their sexual history and coital frequency is normal. The semen analysis of her husband shows a sperm count of 2 million/ejaculate, motility of 4%, and morphology of 14%. The semen report indicates which of the following conditions?

A 55-year-old postmenopausal lady presents in the outpatient department with a complaint of heaviness in her abdomen for the last 4 months. She feels full quickly after small meals and also feels easily fatigued on mild to moderate physical activity. She also complains of constipation off and on. On per abdominal examination, the abdomen is distended with a dull percussion note and a mass is also felt extending up to the umbilicus which is soft in consistency. It has limited mobility and its lower limit can not be reached. All of these findings are suggestive of which of the following diagnoses?

A 60-year-old, postmenopausal woman, P1+0, presents in a gynecology clinic with complaints of abdominal bloating for the last 6 months. She also complains of an increased frequency of micturition. On per abdominal examination, a large mass of 20x15 cm is palpable. It is predominantly solid in consistency. Her ultrasound abdomen and pelvis reveals a large complex mass with increased vascularity arising from the right adnexa. On the left side, there is a 7x8 cm complex mass which is multifocal with solid areas. Which of the following is the most relevant investigation for her assessment?

A 30-year-old, P0+0, is brought to the emergency department with a complaint of lower abdominal pain for 2 days which has worsened and a brief spell of unconsciousness at home. Her pulse is 130 beats/minute, blood pressure is 80/40 mmHg. Abdomen is tender on palpation and some fullness is felt. Her last menstrual period was 35 days back. Her urine pregnancy test is positive. Immediate resuscitation with intravenous fluid is started and her ultrasound pelvis shows a uterus of 7x5x3.5 cm with an endometrial thickness of 0.8 cm. Moderate to significant fluid is seen in the pelvis and peritoneal cavity. A heterogeneous area of about 5x4x3 cm is seen in the right adnexa adjacent to the ovary. Which of the following is the most appropriate management option?

A 31-year-old nulliparous lady comes to a gynecology clinic with the complaint of inability to conceive for the last 6 years and delayed and irregular menstrual cycles for the last 5 years. Her last menstrual period (LMP) was 6 weeks back. Her urine pregnancy test is performed which is negative. Her medical and surgical history is unremarkable. Her body mass index is 27 Kg/m2. On bimanual pelvic examination, the cervix is normal, the uterus is normal size, the fornices clear, no tenderness, and no discharge. Which of the following is the possible contributing factor to her subfertility?

A 20-year-old primigravida presents to the obstetrics emergency department at 32 weeks gestation with complaints of constant headache and vision changes that are not relieved by rest or painkillers. She has no known medical problems. She is noted to have a blood pressure of 150/110 mmHg and her urine dipstick shows 2+ proteinuria. She is advised for admission and observation of her blood pressure and related workup. and management What is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?

A 44-year-old, P3+1, presented with complaints of night sweats, irritability, and poor sleep for 4 months. She has a history of hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy 6 months back due to heavy menstrual bleeding and chronic pelvic pain. Her histopathology report showed adenomyosis. Which of the following is the management of choice in this patient?

A 25-year-old woman, P0+1, attends gynecology clinic with a history of amenorrhea for 7 weeks and occasional mild lower abdominal pain for 3 days. On asking, she reveals some spotting per vaginum. She performs a urine pregnancy test at home which is positive. On examination, her pulse is 88 beats/min, blood pressure is 115/80 mmHg. Her transvaginal ultrasound shows a normal-sized uterus with an endometrial thickness of 0.7 cm and, a left adnexal mass of 3x3 cm which is heterogeneous and predominantly cystic with echogenic foci. There is no fluid in the cul-de-sac. Serum beta hCG level is 2800 mIU/L. The given information suggests the diagnosis of which of the following diseases?

A 16-year-old unmarried girl presents to the gynecology outpatient department as she has not started her menstruation yet. Her secondary sexual characteristics are well-developed according to her age. Her body mass index is normal. She has had cyclical lower abdominal pain for one and a half years. On examination, a mass of about 16 weeks is palpable in the lower abdomen, and on inspection, a tense bluish bulge at the hymen is seen. Which of the following is the most important investigation for her?

A 25-year-old woman comes to the gynecology outpatient department with the complaint of inability to conceive. She has been married for 8 months. Her husband is a 28-year-old nonsmoker with no known comorbidities. She has a normal body mass index. She has regular periods with no known comorbidities. Which of the following is the best treatment option for this couple?

answers.option: Explain to her what the fertile window is and recommend regular intercourse for one year

question: A 34-year-old woman, para 4, all spontaneous vaginal deliveries, comes into the outpatient department with complaints of off-and-on vaginal discharge along with perineal area itching and superficial dyspareunia. On examination of the vulva, a hyperpigmented and bullous lesion is seen. What could be the most probable diagnosis of this condition on inspection?

A 38-year-old, para 2+2, presents at 10 weeks of pregnancy in an antenatal clinic. The patient gives the history of only one live child. Her second child was diagnosed as having Down syndrome and died at the age of 5 years. She is very anxious and wants to know if she is carrying a baby with Down syndrome again. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnostic test for her?

A 25-year-old lady, para 2+0, presents to the clinic at 26 weeks gestation. Her first baby is alive and the second was a preterm delivery of a baby with hydrops fetalis. The patient’s blood group is A negative and her husband is B positive. The patient did not receive anti-D after any of her pregnancies. Cordocentesis will be helpful in the assessment of which of the following disorders?

A 46-year-old, P4+2, last born 12 years back with a body mass index of 31 Kg/m2, diabetic, attends the gynecology outpatient department with complaints of heavy menstrual bleeding for 7 months. Her Hb is 8.9 g/dL. Her transvaginal ultrasound shows endometrial thickness of 1.2 cm. What would be the appropriate management for this patient?

A 30-year-old female nulliparous married for 3 years visited an outpatient department for her fertility issues. She has a regular menstrual cycle and found nothing remarkable on her examination. Her husband's semen analysis report is normal. What would be the appropriate investigation to confirm ovulation?

A 26-year-old primigravida is admitted to the labor room at 38 weeks of gestation. She is having regular painful uterine contractions for 6 hours, 2 in 10 minutes each lasting for 20 seconds. Fetal heart rate is regular at 150 beats per minute. On vaginal examination, the cervix is 6 cm dilated, 60% effaced, and the vertex is at -1 station. What would be the next step in her management?

The Integrated Management of Neonatal and Childhood Illness (IMNCI) classifies children under five into two age categories for case management: (A) from birth up to 2 months and (B) children aged 2 months up to 5 years. In IMNCI, the age group of children from birth to 2 months is labeled as?

A 3-year-old child, Aslam, is brought to the under-5 clinic with a 3-day history of high-grade fever with rigors, loose stools with blood, daily one to two vomiting, and decreased appetite. Yesterday, he had convulsions lasting for 2 minutes but since then no more such events occurred. According to IMNCI, what is the danger sign here?

answers.option: History of convulsions in present illness

question: In Integrated Management of Newborn and Childhood Illness (IMNCI), a 10-month-old child will be labeled as having fast breathing if his/ her respiratory rate is above which of the following?
Immunization is the process of conferring increased resistance (or decreased susceptibility) to infection. In Pakistan, which of the following vaccines are given at birth as per EPI schedule?

Baby Ifrah is now 9 months old. Her parents are very concerned with her health and will visit EPIcenter for her due vaccination at 9 months of age. Which of the following vaccines is/are given at 9 months of age?

answers.option: Measles, Rubella (MR), injectable Polio Vaccine (IPV 2), Typhoid Conjugate Vaccine (TCV)

question: Human milk is specific and it provides all essential nutrients necessary for growth and development. What is the amount of protein in human milk?

Maternal death is defined as the death of a woman from any cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy or its management but not from accident or incident while pregnant or within how many days/months of termination of pregnancy?
Breast milk is produced as a result of hormones and reflexes. Which of the following is milk-secreting hormone?
Pink coding classification in IMNCI shows severe disease. Which of the following signs is considered a danger sign in the Integrated Management of Childhood Illness?

During the menstrual cycle, the dominant follicle produces a substantial amount of estrogen, reducing the development and maturation of other follicles. Which one of the following actions of estrogens is involved in this process?

answers.option: Stimulates the release of FSH from anterior pituitary
Delays the ovulation of maturing follicle
Inhibits further growth of less developed follicles
Accelerates the growth of all follicles
Has no impact on the development of other follicles

question: A 19-year-old female comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of primary amenorrhea. She has well-developed breasts and pubic hairs but the uterus and vagina are absent. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Uterine malformations can cause abnormal uterine bleeding. What is the most common congenital uterine malformation that causes recurrent abortions?
Various problems can arise during the development of the female genital tract. Complete failure of Mullerian duct fusion will result in which of the following?
Congenital anomalies can lead to the absence of certain organs. In incomplete Mullerian duct aplasia, which of the following organs will be present?

A 23-year-old married lady presents with the complaint of repeated bouts of cyclical lower abdominal pain for the last 6 months. Ultrasound shows bilateral ovarian cysts, the largest one measuring 5 cm in diameter. The cyst is removed and sent for histopathology which shows a hemorrhagic cyst lined by hemosiderin-laden macrophages and luteinized granulosa cells. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 55-year-old lady presents with a 3-month history of postmenopausal bleeding, breast tenderness, and abdominal distension. Uterine curettage shows endometrial hyperplasia. Further investigations reveal a large ovarian mass which is surgically removed. Grossly, it is solid to cystic with a slightly yellow cut surface. Microscopy shows sheets of cells with “coffee bean” nuclei showing longitudinal grooves. The cells are forming follicle-like structures with central eosinophilic material. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old medical student is referred to your clinic with an ultrasound report showing a large right ovarian cyst measuring about 10 cm in diameter. The cyst is removed surgically and sent for histopathology. Cysts are unilocular and contain serous fluid. Microscopy shows a cyst lined by a single layer of columnar ciliated epithelium. Which of the following statements is true regarding this patient?

answers.option: Large solid areas are often found in this tumor
Most likely diagnosis is mucinous cyst adenocarcinoma
Serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma is implicated in pathogenesis
This tumor is classified as a surface epithelial tumor

question: Ovarian tumors are mostly benign and usually occur in young women. Which of the following statements is correct regarding ovarian tumors?

answers.option: Endometriosis is implicated in pathogenesis of low grade epithelial tumors
Mucinous tumors are bilateral in 80% of cases
Immature teratoma is the commonest type of germ cell tumor
Ovarian dysgerminoma is the counterpart of embryonal carcinoma in the testis
Pseudomyxoma peritonei is a primary ovarian tumor

question: A 35-year-old lady undergoes surgery for a large ovarian cyst. The cyst is unilocular and contains cheesy material, hair, and teeth. Microscopically, it is lined by skin with sebaceous glands and hair follicles. Other areas show mature fatty tissue, cartilage, and thyroid follicles. No primitive tissue is seen. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 2-year-old girl presents with an ovarian mass. Laboratory tests show a markedly raised level of alpha-fetoprotein. Microscopy of the growth shows a tumor composed of cuboidal cells in a lace-like pattern with numerous glomeruloid structures. Which of the following statements is true regarding this tumor?

answers.option: Most likely diagnosis in this scenario is choriocarcinoma
In boys, this tumor is called a seminoma
Glomeruloid structures are called Schiller-Duval bodies
This is a type or teratoma
It usually has a benign course

question: A 52-year-old, who is a mother of 6, presents to your clinic with a palpable mass just under the areola of her breast. She complains of thick, whitish secretions from her nipple. Biopsy shows dilated ducts filled with inspissated secretions and surrounded by foamy macrophages and marked chronic inflammation. Which of the following statements regarding this patient’s diagnosis is true?

answers.option: Usually occurs in young lactating mothers
Squamous metaplasia of ducts is a prominent feature

question: A 24-year-old male comes with complaints of swelling in the right testis for 6 months. On microscopic examination, components of germinal cell layers are recovered. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 33-year-old female comes with complaints of itching, discharge, and polypoidal growth on the vulva. On microscopic examination, there is a benign papillomatous squamous proliferation with a fibrovascular core. Keratinocytes show koilocytic changes. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 42-year-old female comes with complaints of itching, discharge, and polypoidal growth on the vulva. On microscopic examination, there is a benign papillomatous growth composed of mature squamous cells with raisinoid nuclei with a clear halo around nuclei. What is the most probable cause?

Most testicular germ cell tumors originate from precursor lesions called intratubular germ cell neoplasm/ germ cell neoplasm in situ. Which of the following tumors do not arise from intratubular germ cell neoplasm (ITGCN)?
A 20-year-old male came with swelling of left testis for 1 year. Based on morphology, spermatocytic seminoma can be differentiated from seminoma by the presence of which of the following?
Schiller-Duval bodies are characteristic features of which of the following?
Lichen sclerosis is associated with which one of the following?

A 38-year-old male presents with a unilateral painless palpable mass in the left testis. His serum alpha-fetoprotein and beta hcg levels are normal with mild lactate dehydrogenase elevation. On microscopic examination, it is composed of sheets of large monotonous cells with rounded nuclei with prominent nucleoli and eosinophilic cytoplasm. What would be the most typical first site of metastasis?
Which of the following is the most common genetic abnormality/ mutation observed in type 1 endometrioid carcinoma?
Which of the following is the most common signaling pathway responsible for endometrioid carcinoma?
What is the most probable pathological stage if the endometrial carcinoma is confined to the uterus?
Which type of mutation is present in 90% of serous endometrial carcinoma?

A 70-year-old healthy man has a routine check-up. On physical examination, a firm nodule is palpable in the prostate via digital rectal examination. An MRI scan confirms the presence and location of a posterior 0.4 cm nodule. Prostate biopsies are performed and microscopic examination shows small crowded glands containing cells with prominent nucleoli within the nuclei. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following statements is the most pertinent to prostate cancer?

answers.option: Gleason score 4+3 describes a poorly differentiated tumor
Gleason score 3+4 is grade group 4 tumor
T2 describes a tumor that has extended through the capsule
65% of patients with Gleason score 5-7 will die from prostate cancer within 15 years
PSA>50 ng/mL is often associated with distant bone metastasis

question: A 20-year-old woman has multiple sex partners. She has a fever and left lower quadrant abdominal pain with onset in association with her menstrual period since the last two cycles. The pap smear and culture show Neisseria gonorrhoeae growth. Diagnosis of gonococcal pelvic inflammatory disease is made. What is the common sequela of this infection?
A multigravida after 6th delivery is advised for the process of sterilization (birth control contraception). Which of the following structures is ligated in this female?

An 8-hour-old newborn, delivered by a primigravida at 33 weeks of gestation through emergency lower segment cesarean section is brought to the emergency room with a history of difficulty in breathing since birth. On examination, his heart rate is 155 beats/min, respiratory rate is 70 breaths/min, and SpO2 is 92% at room air and 98% at 4L of oxygen He is having intercostal and subcostal recessions. X-ray chest shows ground glass appearance. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Parents brought a 7-year-old female child to you with complaints of increasing breast size since the last 4 months. There is no history of consanguinity and similar problems in the family. No history of any chronic illness and use of long-term medications. Her birth was uneventful. On examination, vitals are normal, and height and weight are at the 50th percentile. Local examination of the breast revealed elevation of the areola with contour surrounding the breast on both sides. The development of pubic hairs is almost like adults. What is the tanner staging of this child?

You are called to examine a neonate born to a mother having pregnancy-induced hypertension. His weight is below the 10th percentile. His height and head circumference are below the 5th percentile. The baby does not have any dysmorphic features. How will you classify this baby?

The mother of a 10-day-old baby comes with a complaint of facing difficulty in breastfeeding her newborn. The pediatrician asks her to feed the baby to find out the problem. The proper positioning and attachments do not require which of the following?

answers.option: More areola should be visible above than below the mouth
Baby’s whole body should be supported
Lower lip of baby should be turned out
Mother’s breast should be supported by her hand with scissor grip around the nipple
Baby should be facing mother and her breast

question: A newborn baby is delivered via emergency cesarean section at 35 weeks of gestation to a mother with no known comorbidities. His APGAR score is 5 at 1 minute and respiratory efforts are poor. Initial steps are performed and the baby is started on positive pressure ventilation (PPV). After 30 seconds of effective PPV, the chest expansion is inadequate and the heart rate is 56 breaths per minute. Which of the following should be the next step in the resuscitation of this child?

answers.option: Repositioning and suctioning of the airway
Adjust the mask and make effective seal
Perform endotracheal intubation and start chest compressions

question: An infant born at 31 weeks gestation is now 6 days old. He is on enteral feeding. Now, he has bilious vomiting for 3 hours and passes bloody stools, his abdomen is distended. X-ray abdomen shows pneumatosis intestinalis. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 34-year-old lady developed a vaginal fistula as a result of prolonged labor. What is the most common location where vaginal fistula develops?

answers.option: Between vagina and urethra and bladder

question: By the contraction of the spermatic cord, the testis is not taken to the abdominal cavity due to the presence of which of the following?

answers.option: Attachment of testis by gubernaculum to the scrotal sac only
Both narrowness of inguinal canal and epididymis
Fat bodies and gubernaculum present over testis

question: A 25-year-old graduate visits a rural community to survey their general health status. He finds a high prevalence of sexually transmitted diseases and a total birth rate in this community. He wants to avail medical grants to improve reproductive health in this community. Which of the following is the most important initial step toward the promotion of reproductive health in that community?

answers.option: Shifting restricted culture towards sexual health

question: You are posted as a medical officer in a rural area and you have been assigned a task on raising the awareness regarding reproductive health of women. Which of the following are components of reproductive health?

answers.option: Maternal health, child health, diseases of females
General health of peoples, contraception, abortion
Health of youth, contraception, abortion, sexually transmitted diseases

question: A 30-year-old male, matriculate, electric technician, married for 2 years is referred to you for assessment of underlying psychological causes for not consummating his marriage. He has no past medical or surgical history. His physical examination and relevant laboratory investigations are also normal. On assessment, he is found to be anxious and used to setting high expectations in achieving any goal since earlier. He has a supportive partner and no obvious stressors. Which of the following factors is most likely responsible for his reproductive dysfunction?

A 38-year-old woman on oral contraceptives for 18 years thinks that this preparation may prove to be not only beneficial in preventing pregnancy but also beneficial in the reduction of cancer risk. Which of the following cancers may show a decreased incidence because of her prolonged use of oral contraceptives?

A 32-year-old woman with early-stage estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) breast cancer requires treatment. You elect to start therapy with a selective estrogen receptor modulator that exerts its effects by binding to and inhibiting the estrogen receptor expressed in breast tumor cells. Which medication will you prescribe for this patient?
Which of the following is a selective estrogen receptor modulator that improves bone mineral density in postmenopausal women?
Which of the following is a synthetic progesterone devoid of systemic androgenic effect?

A breastfeeding woman is taking oral contraceptives. After a few months, she notices some hair growing on her face and acne. Which one of the following drugs is responsible for causing these symptoms?

A middle-aged man presents with a complaint of right testicular heaviness. The examination reveals a painless and hard testicular lump. The initial workup consisting of alpha-fetoprotein, beta HCG, and lactate dehydrogenase is advised. Abnormally high levels of all three are found. What should be the next step in the evaluation of this patient?

answers.option: Tumor markers have limited role to follow response to treatment
Platinum-based chemotherapy has no role in patients with testicular tumor
Followup after 6 months and repeat above markers

question: A demographer wants to predict the actual number of population after 20 years, which one of the following measures of fertility would be appropriate for the projection of population?

A 39-year-old male patient presents in the outpatient department with a history of high-grade fever and painful testicular swelling. Upon further evaluation, his scrotum on the left side is erythematous and warm and imaging reveals reactive hydrocele. What should be the next most appropriate clinical approach for this patient?

answers.option: Oral antibiotics for both chlamydia and gonococcal infection as per WHO guidelines
Immediate exploration to rule out testicular torsion

question: Mrs.XYZ is a 42-year-old woman who visited an antenatal clinic at 14+3 weeks of pregnancy. Her age is a risk factor for Down’s syndrome and she wants confirmation of this problem via prenatal testing. Which one of the following is the best invasive prenatal testing for the diagnosis of this condition?

A 24-year-old girl came to the out-patient-department with a history of prolonged menstrual cycle for months and increasing hair growth on chin and breast. Which of the following is not included in Rotterdam criteria?

answers.option: Increase LH/FSH ratio/Increase free androgen index

question: A 35-year-old woman came to gynaecology out-patient-department with a complaint of inability to conceive. She has been married for 5 years. Her husband is 38-years-old. Her husband had 2 kids from his first wife. Her body mass index is normal, serum FSH and LH and ultrasound pelvis are all unremarkable. She gives a history of dysmenorrhea and dyspareunia. What is the most important investigation for her?

A subfertile young couple visited the out-patient department with investigation of female partner serum progesterone day 21; 35 ng/mL, hysterosalpingography shows both tubes patent with normal uterine cavity. Her husband semen analysis shows pH 7.2, quantity 4 mL, sperm count 40 million/dL with motility normal forward movement of 5% and morphology 4%. What would be the most appropriate treatment option for this couple?

A 30-year-old nulliparous female married for 8 years attended gynaecology out-patient-department with complaints of heavy menstrual bleeding and generalized weakness for the last 6 months. She looks pale, pelvic examination shows a mass of about 20 weeks size, firm in consistency. Her Hb is 4.3. Ultrasound shows a solitary intramural fibroid of about 7*8 cm. She is very much concerned about her sub fertility because her marriage is at risk. What would be the immediate step in her treatment?

A 28-year-old nulliparous woman came in out-patient-department with a complaint of inability to conceive for 4 years. She has regular menstrual cycles. She has a history of appendectomy 2 years back. What could be the likely cause of her sub fertility from the following?

A 29-year-old patient gravida 2 para 1+0 came for antenatal care in a primary health care center at 32 weeks of gestation. Her blood group is O negative. Hb is 10 gm/dL. Her obstetrical ultrasound is normal. What is the most appropriate step in her management?

answers.option: Advice her obstetrical ultrasound at 36 weeks
Refer her to tertiary care center

question: A 32-year-old woman, P2+0, last born six months back, presents to the gynaecology clinic with amenorrhea for three months. She has a history of irregular periods for six months and weight gain for five months. She is breastfeeding her baby and her body mass index is normal. Which of the following investigations will you advise her?
A pediatrician finds urethral meatus on the undersurface of penis during examination of a newborn. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following types corresponds to Bacille Calmette-Guerin vaccine given for tuberculosis?

A female with a known case of diabetes and gestational hypertension at the 37th week of gestation presents with a complaint of rupture of membranes. While in labor, she suddenly experiences shortness of breath, restlessness, and chest pain. What is the most probable cause of these symptoms in this patient?

A 30-year-old male presents with a mass on the testis. Histopathology of the tumor reveals large multinucleated giant cells and mononuclear cells showing extensive hemorrhage and necrosis. What is the origin of these cells?
What is the percentage of breech presentations at term?
When the body produces antibodies in response to infection or vaccination, what type of immunity is it?
What is the most common complication of dichorionic diamniotic twin pregnancy?

A lady presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of urinary incontinence after delivery. Urodynamic studies show leakage during increased intra-abdominal pressure and confirm the diagnosis of stress incontinence. What should be the first-line management?

A 19-year-old tall girl presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of primary amenorrhea. On examination, pubic and axillary hair is sparse, and genitalia are ambiguous. On ultrasound, the uterus is absent. Her karyotype is XY. What can be the cause of the primary amenorrhea?
Which of the following is the invasive screening technique for Down syndrome at the 10th week of gestation?

A newborn presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of yellowish discoloration of sclera after birth. His blood group is O positive whereas that of his mother is A negative. His elder sister also had a history of blood exchange. What is the cause of jaundice and kernicterus?

answers.option: Jaundice due to Rh factor incompatibility

question: A pregnant lady with a known case of pregnancy-induced hypertension suffered from convulsions near term and presented to the emergency room in a dead state. Her pupils were dilated but fixed. What is the most likely cause of her death?
What is the site at which the uterus is felt one hour after delivery?

A 6-year-old girl presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of an enlarging breast. On examination, a mass is palpated in her lower abdomen. She is tanner stage 3 with no axillary or pubic hair. What investigations will you perform?

answers.option: Mammography of breast and U/S abdomen

question: A 20-year-old girl presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of a painless palpable lump on her breast for the last 8 months. It is firm, mobile, and non-tender. What is the diagnosis of this case?

Mrs. XYZ is experiencing labor contractions and her family is urgently taking her to the hospital. However, they are stuck in traffic on Shahrah-e-Faisal for four hours due to a protest by people against a recently passed legislation. According to the 3-delays model, which category does this situation belong to?

answers.option: Delay II, delay in reaching the healthcare facility
Delay III, delay in provision of appropriate healthcare
Delay I, delay in receiving care at hospital
Delay I, lack of decision making
Delay III, delay in deciding to seek care

question: Which of the following non-steroidal anti-androgen drugs is given for palliation in advance prostate adenocarcinoma?
Which of the following is the most appropriate definition of intrauterine fetal death?

answers.option: Fetus dies in utero after 12 weeks of gestation
Fetus dies in utero after 10 weeks of gestation
Fetus dies in utero after 18 weeks of gestation
Fetus dies in utero after 24 weeks of gestation
Fetus dies in utero after 14 weeks of gestation

question: A 50-year-old female is found to have increased endometrial thickness. Biopsy of the tissue reveals an increased gland-to-stroma ratio with enlarged hyperchromatic nuclei showing complex stratifications. What is the likely diagnosis?

A term infant presents in the emergency room with a complaint of respiratory distress. A chest radiograph reveals well-aerated lungs with fluid in the fissures on the right, prominent pulmonary vascular markings, and a flat diaphragm. The infant improves within 24 hours and requires no medication. What is the probable diagnosis of this patient?
Which of the following structures is analogous to gubernaculum in females?
A female presents to the OPD with complaints of low mood, decreased appetite, and difficulty sleeping. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following vaccines are administered at 14 weeks of age as per EPI schedule?
Which of the following vaccines are administered at 15 months of age as per EPI?
What is the percentage of ectopic pregnancies with tubal implantation?
A man is diagnosed with stage I non-seminomatous testicular tumor which was removed by radical orchiectomy. What is the next most appropriate step of treatment?

A child presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of cough, increased breathing rate, irritability, costal recessions, and chest indrawings. He is unable to feed and has now developed convulsions. What is the probable diagnosis according to the IMNCI?
A child presented to the clinic with his head circumference and his upper and lower limb growth at less than 10th percentile. In which of the following categories is the child classified?
Which of the following is classified as a fast breathing rate for a 3-month-old infant according to the integrated management of newborn and childhood Illness (IMNCI)?
Which of the following is the reason for combining estrogen and progesterone in oral contraceptive pills?
Which of the following structures provides level 1 support to the pelvic organs?
What is the reason for prescribing estrogen therapy in postmenopausal women?

A 20-year-old unmarried nulliparous female presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of heavy menstrual bleeding. On ultrasound, two intramural fibroids measuring 8x12 cm are seen. What is the appropriate treatment for this patient?

A 40-year-old lady with three previous pregnancies presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of amenorrhea for the past 2 months. Her last pregnancy was two years ago. Which of the following is the appropriate hormone to test in this patient?

A female patient presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of vaginal bleeding for 3 months. On examination, there is increased glandular proliferation in the endometrium without an increase in stroma. It involves the whole thickness of the endometrium but has not spread to any other structure. Which of the following statements is true about this condition?

answers.option: It is a high grade mucinous carcinoma
It is a high grade serous carcinoma
It involves pathogenesis through PI3K/AKT pathway

question: A woman with previous cesarean section delivery 3 years ago is adamant about having a normal vaginal delivery. What is the most important risk you should warn her about?

A child gets injured and is brought to the outpatient department for a checkup of his skin wound. You clean the wound and administer prophylaxis against tetanus since he has never been vaccinated against tetanus before. What prophylaxis will be appropriate for this patient?

answers.option: Tetanus immunoglobulin and first dose of tetanus toxoid
Anti-tetanus serum and first dose of tetanus vaccine

question: Which of the following conditions is most commonly associated with endometriosis?

A 2-day-old neonate is brought to the emergency room with a complaint of fever and cough. On examination, the child is febrile, toxic-looking with tachypnea, and chest indrawings. What is the most probable diagnosis of this patient?
What is the likely diagnosis of an epithelial tumor containing cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast proliferation, but no chorionic villi?

A patient presented to the emergency room with severe abdominal pain, shoulder tip pain, and vaginal bleeding. She had amenorrhea for 2 months. On ultrasound, it showed a dilated and ragged fallopian tube. A provisional diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy was made. What would be the most appropriate management option for this patient?

answers.option: Emergency surgery for ruptured ectopic pregnancy

question: A neonate presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of fever and fits. On examination, the child is hypotonic and has diminished reflexes. There is no history of birth asphyxia. What is the probable diagnosis of this patient?

A pregnant patient presents to the outpatient department with a complete blood count report showing hemoglobin 8 mg/dL, mean corpuscular volume (MCV) 68 fl, and hematocrit 36%. What is the next most appropriate management option for this patient?
A 69-year-old female patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of post-menopausal bleeding. What is the gold standard investigation for endometrial biopsy?

A pregnant patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of first-trimester bleeding and vaginal passage of grape-like vesicles. On investigation, her beta HCG levels were highly elevated, whereas on ultrasound, it showed a snow-storm appearance. Which of the following statements is correct about this condition?

answers.option: It is also called triploid mole
Trophoblastic proliferation is focal and slight
Genetic material is from paternal side only

question: Which hormone is responsible for the formation of spermatozoa from spermatids by acting on Sertoli cells?

A young male smoker is incidentally found to have an undescended right testis. His father and uncle also had the same condition. What is the most important risk factor for germ cell tumors in his medical history?
When a critical proportion of a community is vaccinated in such a way that it leads to an overall reduction in risk of a disease in the community, what is the type of immunity called?
Which of the following is an anti-progestin?
Which of the following is a symptom of severe pneumonia as per integrated management of neonatal & childhood illness (IMNCI)?

An infant was brought to the clinic with complaints of fever and seizures. During the examination, the child had a bulging anterior fontanelle. CSF analysis was performed which showed elevated total leukocyte count with 80% neutrophils, and CSF glucose levels of 20 mg/dl. The child's blood sugar levels were found to be 80 mg/dl. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A female patient presents to the clinic with an ulcer in the genital tract which is painless. She is found to have a sexually transmitted disease. What is the correct term for such lesions?

A young African female with multiple sexual partners presents to the clinic with dyspareunia and dysuria. On examination, she is found to have an ulcer in the genital tract which is tender and painful but not indurated. The physician suspects a chancroid. What is the causative organism of this lesion?
A young female presents with a painful rash in the genital tract. On examination, multiple painful vesicles are seen on the vulva. What is the diagnosis?
A 40-year-old woman at 10 weeks of gestation wants to know if her child will be having Down syndrome. What is a special scan that will indicate if further testing is required?
A couple married for 3 years is unable to consummate the marriage. The female experiences superficial dyspareunia and apprehension. She has regular menstrual cycles. What is the likely cause?

A couple presents to the clinic with a concern that they are unable to find one testis of their newborn. The doctor confirms the findings of the parents after examination. 30 years later, the man develops a urogenital tumor composed of sheets of uniform cells that has also spread to retro-peritoneal para-aortic lymph nodes. What is the most likely diagnosis of this tumor?
Which of the following is an indication to use progesterone without estrogen?
Which of the following is a tumor marker for mucinous cystadenoma?
A woman with a history of epilepsy since childhood wishes to conceive. Which of the following drugs can be safely administered during pregnancy?
What is the sensitivity of pap smear screening for high-grade cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN)?

A 20-year-old male presents with a soft, rubbery growth on his testis. The tumor is homogenous, lobulated, and gray-white on the cut surface. Serological markers are negative. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 24-year-old married female presents with an erythematous subareolar mass. Examination reveals the formation of a fistula tract at the edge of the areola along with inflammation and scarring of the nipple. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 21-year-old girl presents with low mood, mastalgia, abdominal pain, and gut disturbance one week before menstruation. The symptoms occur every month and interfere with her social life and daily activities. Her menstrual cycle is regular. What is the likely cause of her presentation?

A 36-year-old woman, G4P2+1, with a history of spontaneous vaginal deliveries at 33 and 35 weeks gestation presents to the OPD at 14 weeks gestation for routine follow-up. Her last pregnancy resulted in a miscarriage at 17 weeks. Which of the following tests should be performed in this case?

A 36-year-old woman, G4P2+1, with a history of spontaneous vaginal deliveries at 33 and 35 weeks gestation presents to the outpatient department at 14 weeks gestation for routine follow-up. Her last pregnancy had resulted in a miscarriage at 17 weeks. Ultrasound report shows a single intrauterine fetus and a cervical length of 21 mm. Which of the following is the appropriate management plan?

A 15-year-old girl presents with complaints of increasing abdominal pain, vaginal swelling, and pain during micturition. Her breast development is normal but she has not begun to menstruate. On observation of the genitalia, a tense blue swelling at the level of the hymen is seen. What is the likely diagnosis?
From which embryological structure do primordial germ cells migrate toward the genital ridge?

A 53-year-old woman presents with persistent pelvic pain and abdominal distension. Ultrasound scan shows a large pelvic mass of 12 cm x 15 cm in diameter which is attached to the omentum. The tumor has a heterogeneous appearance with solid and cystic components. What is the best management option for this patient?

answers.option: Total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

question: A 50-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of increased urinary frequency and urgency. Serum PSA levels are found to be >4.9 ng. Histopathology of the prostate confirms a tumor with Gleason Scores of 2+2(4) and 2+3(5). What is the most likely diagnosis?
When is the first dose of the rotavirus vaccine administered?

A 14-week-old girl's parents are very concerned about her health and brought her to the EPI vaccination center. According to the EPI schedule, which of the following sets of vaccines will she be given?
